Issues.Title: ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

sveltekit

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.3.0

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox, Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/PwsDG36K97

**Describe your issue**

I don't know if this intended or is a bug;
but when using `ring` with `ring-opacity` on a dark color scheme,
the dark variant ignores the `ring-opacity`, but works if `dark:ring-opacity` is present
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme" (#11950)

Issues.Title: Split background color While I only have one color
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** postcss-cli 8.4.28 Next.js 13.4.19, webpack 5.88.2 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v20.3.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome, edge, Arc **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. [See here](https://play.tailwindcss.com/mPWKwBxGTB?file=config) **Describe your issue** As you can see the background is split in two color while the body has only custom one named bg-dark-50. If you put a border 1px solid everywhere, or add opacity bg-dark-50/90 or even disable margin-0 on layout.css it fixes the problem. You can even just change the color. But unfortunately that's my background color ^^ I tried with different dark colors some work other don't. For example #1A1A1A has no problem. Hope it helps. Sure it could help me. Thank you for your time. :) Edit: You need a screen that can display Rec 709 or almost adobe RGB 1998. For example Apple RGB or lowest are not wide enough to display full colors
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Split background color While I only have one color" (#11946)

Issues.Title: `matchUtilities` can't handle nested values
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`matchUtilities` can't handle nested values" (#11942)

Issues.Title: Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities
Issues.Body: Adds utilities for [`forced-colors-adjust`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/forced-color-adjust)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities" (#11931)

Issues.Title: Add scripting variants
Issues.Body: This adds two variants for the [`scripting`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/scripting) media query. `noscript` for when JavaScript is disabled and `scripting` for when it's enabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add scripting variants" (#11929)

Issues.Title: Free components render extra large!
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/11909
Originally posted by **BaltWeb** August 26, 2023 I am new to Tailwind and would like to start by using the free of charge components, with code readily available to code and use from the Tailwind UI page. Taking the first Application UI free component as example to explain the issue, this : https://tailwindui.com/components/application-ui/application-shells/stacked Coping and pasting the HTML code to render, on running it does not render correctly; and is displayed very large in the browser, please see P1 & P2 attached. This issue persists when running via the terminal / localhost and also when run with VS Code, Apache and Codepen. I also tested for this issue on a different pc using Codepen only; finding the same large rendering issue also. Further to the above, I have gone further and tried some of the other free components available, with the same rendering issue also! Please let me know what may be the root cause of the issue and how to resolve it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Free components render extra large!" (#11923)

Issues.Title: [Issue] font-[inherit] is assigned to font-family
Issues.Body:
Hey folks.

Today I tried to `font-[inherit]` (with prose), and saw that the generated style is font-family.
I'd think more relevant to have it in font-weight. 
WDYT?

More generaly, how have you though this kind of conflict?

Thanks.

In the commit, the failing test.

See you. 
üëã
Mathieu.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[Issue] font-[inherit] is assigned to font-family" (#11917)

Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è lightningcss (1.21.5 ‚Üí 1.21.7) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss)

1.21.6

Fixes

  • Parse the @starting-style rule
  • Fix custom top-level style blocks when not nested

  • Make a node specific wasm build that initializes synchronously for stackblitz
  • Add freebsd build

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Issues.Title: Free components render extra large!
Issues.Body:
I am new to Tailwind and would like to start by using the free of charge components, with code readily available to code and use from the Tailwind UI page.  Taking the first Application UI free component as example to explain the issue, this :

https://tailwindui.com/components/application-ui/application-shells/stacked

Coping and pasting the HTML code to render, on running it does not render correctly; and is displayed very large in the browser, please see P1 & P2 attached. 

This issue persists when running via the terminal / localhost and also when run with VS Code, Apache and Codepen. I also tested for this issue on a different pc using Codepen only; finding the same large rendering issue also. 

Further to the above, I have gone further and tried some of the other free components available, with the same rendering issue also!

Please let me know what may be the root cause of the issue and  how to resolve it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Free components render extra large!" (#11908)

Issues.Title: Expose variants to matchUtilities
Issues.Body:
Hello Tailwind team! I didn't ask first about this one because it's so tiny; I hope that's OK!

I'm in the process of writing a fluid type utility and encountered an unusual situation where I wanted to know from within the utility if it was being used with a screen variant, so I could change some values accordingly. I figured it would make most sense to pass the `variants` through to `matchUtilities`/`matchComponents` in the `extra` object that already holds `modifiers`. I can't think of any negative side effects, because the variants still get applied. For simplicity, I'm only passing through the variant names for now but I could potentially expand it to perhaps show selectors as well (similar to `context.getVariants()`). Any thoughts?

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Expose variants to matchUtilities" (#11906)

Issues.Title: Update sass 1.64.1 ‚Üí 1.66.1 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sass (1.64.1 ‚Üí 1.66.1) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.66.1

To install Sass 1.66.1, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

JS API

  • Fix a bug where Sass compilation could crash in strict mode if passed a callback that threw a string, boolean, number, symbol, or bignum.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

1.66.0

To install Sass 1.66.0, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Breaking change: Drop support for the additional CSS calculations defined in CSS Values and Units 4. Custom Sass functions whose names overlapped with these new CSS functions were being parsed as CSS calculations instead, causing an unintentional breaking change outside our normal [compatibility policy] for CSS compatibility changes.

    Support will be added again in a future version, but only after Sass has emitted a deprecation warning for all functions that will break for at least three months prior to the breakage.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

1.65.1

To install Sass 1.65.1, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Update abs-percent deprecatedIn version to 1.65.0.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

1.64.2

To install Sass 1.64.2, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

Dart API

  • Include protocol buffer definitions when uploading the sass package to pub.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 13 commits:

  • Use wrapJSExceptions() to work around dart-lang/sdk#53105 (#2055)
  • Merge pull request #2067 from sass/revert-calc
  • Update pubspec and changelog and re-add abs-percent deprecation
  • Revert "Calc functions implementation (#1970)"
  • Revert "Update abs-percent deprecatedIn version (#2057)"
  • Bump http from 0.13.6 to 1.1.0 (#2062)
  • Update abs-percent deprecatedIn version (#2057)
  • Calc functions implementation (#1970)
  • Deprecate explicitly passing null as an alpha value (#2049)
  • Add ignores to work around dart-lang/linter#4381 (#2053)
  • Convert Sass to Dart 3 style (#2038)
  • Add a pubignore so pub knows to publish protobuf files (#2050)
  • Include protobuf definitions in the pub package (#2048)
#### ‚ú≥Ô∏è jiti (1.19.1 ‚Üí 1.19.3) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/unjs/jiti) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/unjs/jiti/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.19.3

compare changes

ü©π Fixes

  • Only replace import.meta.env (c6895d6)

‚ù§Ô∏è Contributors

  • Pooya Parsa (@pi0)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 14 commits:

  • chore(release): v1.19.3
  • fix: only replace `import.meta.env`
  • chore(release): v1.19.2
  • fix: support `import.meta.env` and `import.meta.env?.prop` (#159)
  • chore: upgrade dependencies
  • chore(deps): update pnpm to v8.6.12 (#155)
  • style: format report with prettier
  • chore: update dependencies
  • test(typescript): remove type-only namespace access
  • fix: pass custom extensions to esm resolver (#152)
  • chore: add autofix ci
  • style: format with prettier v3
  • chore: update dependencies
  • chore(deps): update all non-major dependencies (#149)

Issues.Title: Hover states break in componentized elements
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
Autoprefixer 10.4.15, Next.js 13.4.12, PostCSS 8.4.28

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v20.5.1

**What browser are you using?**
Arc Version 1.5.0 (41058) - (Chromium Engine Version 116.0.5845.110)

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
Example of a componentized button function that's hover state breaks when imported and used elsewhere https://github.com/developedbytoby/website/blob/dcf09a011cec27726b7a8375b4edc04fc762bf11/components/design/button.tsx#L4

**Describe your issue**
When I componentize an element which has Tailwind styling, and use that element in another place, the hover state breaks. Please let me know if you need me to elaborate on anything! :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Hover states break in componentized elements" (#11901)

Issues.Title: TailwindCDN breaks when loading a custom plugin within an iframe
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.7.2

**What build tool are you using?**

parcel v2.0.0, but it seems unrelated (also tried on esbuild v0.17.19)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.18.1 (also tried on v18.14.2)

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://codesandbox.io/s/tailwindcdn-with-cusotm-plugins-in-iframe-gj9fkl

**Describe your issue**

TailwindCDN breaks when loading a custom plugin within an iframe.

[It works flawlessly with custom plugins outside iframes, as you can see at this CodeSandbox link](https://codesandbox.io/s/tailwindcdn-with-cusotm-plugins-6tqwgj?file=/index.mjs). Here, the logic is similar to  one of the bug reproduction ‚Äì the assigned `tailwind.config` is the same.

However, when you place it within an iframe, it throws "raws is undefined" from `...t[1].raws.tailwind` in the producion code.

The issue seems to be adding plugins. If you uncomment the example custom plugin from the plugins array in the bug reproduction code (`/index.mjs`, line 23), it loads properly.

Am I doing something wrong? I'd be happy to contribute.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TailwindCDN breaks when loading a custom plugin within an iframe" (#11899)

Issues.Title: Provide hashes for release binaries to ensure the integrity and authenticity
Issues.Body:
Currently, the released binaries are missing hashes. To ensure that what is being downloaded is also what has been built by your pipeline, could you please distribute hashes together with the binaries?

Issues.Title: Not working for PHP
Issues.Body:
Hello, thank you for your amazing work.

I'm tyring this extension for PHP file...I already add the below code in the `setting.json`:

`
"tailwindCSS.includeLanguages": {
   "php": "php"
}
`

The problem is that I don't know why most for the time the autocompletion / suggestion won't show.
I follow the official guild here for PHP `https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/php`.

Am I missing anything or it doesn't work correctly with PHP? Thank you in advanced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Not working for PHP" (#11874)

Issues.Title: Problem with fixed inside @container query
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Edge, Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows, Android

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/LLf0eoCuKG

**Describe your issue**

The **fixed** utility is beheaving as *absolute* when present as a descendant of an element with *@container* class. It's seems an issue with "container-type: inline-size;" rule.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Problem with fixed inside @container query " (#11872)

Issues.Title: Arbitrary values don't work when using a responsive variant for grid-template-columns
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 13.4.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18.14.0

**What browser are you using?**

Brave

**What operating system are you using?**

OSX

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/Qt1wDyijtD

**Describe your issue**

I'm trying to get `.grid-cols` to work using arbitrary values and responsive variants. The example provided at the end [here](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/grid-template-columns) seems to work fine, but not if targeting a breakpoint (e.g. `grid-cols-[200px_minmax(900px,_1fr)_100px]` works, but `lg:grid-cols-[200px_minmax(900px,_1fr)_100px]` doesn't ‚Äì see the playground link). 

I can't see anything in the docs that suggests this shouldn't work, so I'm guessing this might be a bug?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Arbitrary values don't work when using a responsive variant for grid-template-columns" (#11870)

Issues.Title: Opacity utilities not working on Tailwind built with Remix.
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** Latest **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Remix 1.19 **What version of Node.js are you using?** 18.17.1 **What browser are you using?** Safari **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** Here in play all works as expected: [Play](https://play.tailwindcss.com/2ohggJVmAo) The same code produces this in remix generated tailwind. (see attached photo).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Opacity utilities not working on Tailwind built with Remix." (#11866)

Issues.Title: Can't use calc() as arbitrary value
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** this [CDN](https://cdn.tailwindcss.com) **What browser are you using?** Opera **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/WSskKFuUi5 **Describe your issue** I wanted to use the sin() & cos() trigonometric functions and found out that the arbitrary calc() values don't work, or at least if you have some calculation inside of the calc(). Code i wanted to implement: `
`

Issues.Title: Update eslint 8.45.0 ‚Üí 8.47.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è eslint-config-prettier (8.10.0 ‚Üí 9.0.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

9.0.0 (from changelog)

  • Added: The CLI helper tool now works with eslint.config.js (flat config). Just like ESLint itself, the CLI tool automatically first tries eslint.config.js and then eslintrc, and you can force which one to use by setting the ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG environment variable. Note that the config of eslint-config-prettier has always been compatible with eslint.config.js (flat config) ‚Äì it was just the CLI tool that needed updating. On top of that, the docs have been updated to mention how to use both eslint.config.js (flat config) and eslintrc, and the tests now test both config systems.
  • Changed: unicode-bom is no longer turned off. Prettier preserves the BOM if you have one, and does not add one if missing. It was wrong of eslint-config-prettier to disable that rule. If you get ESLint errors after upgrading, either add "unicode-bom": "off" to your config to disable it again, or run ESLint with --fix to fix all files according to the rule (add or remove BOM). Thanks to Nicolas Stepien (@nstepien)!

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 3 commits:

  • eslint-config-prettier v9.0.0
  • Do not disable unicode-bom (#250)
  • Flat config: CLI, tests, docs (#261)

Issues.Title: Setting default ring color to "inherit" fails.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vite, but reproduced in tailwind play

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18

**What browser are you using?**

Brave (Chromium)

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/xqF3SqtvfH

**Describe your issue**

Trying to set the default ring color to "inherit" fails. See tailwind play link.

Issues.Title: Erroneous lint warning applying scale-x and scale-y
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

tailwind v3.2.4
headless-ui 0.1.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

react-scripts 5.0.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v18.12.1

**What browser are you using?**

n/a (pre-compilation)

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

As this is a lint warning here is a screenshot instead of a URL
![Screen Shot 2023-08-17 at 11 57 16 AM](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/94571813/68b11700-2af6-4556-b5b1-83510c38c476)

**Describe your issue**

This is just one of those annoying bugs that doesn't really affect anything after compilation.  But anyway... applying `scale-x-<num>` and `scale-y-<num>` results in a linting warning that I cannot seem to disappear with eslint-disable or ts-ignore. 

Actual warning: `'scale-x-[1.01]' applies the same CSS properties as 'scale-y-105'.(cssConflict)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Erroneous lint warning applying scale-x and scale-y" (#11843)

Issues.Title: 'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict)
Issues.Body:
### I want disable this warning ```css 'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict) ```

### I have this code src/components/Switch.tsx ```tsx interface SwitchProps extends React.InputHTMLAttributes { isChecked: boolean onChange: () => void } export function Switch({ isChecked = false, onChange, ...props }: SwitchProps) { return ( ) } ``` error here - translate-x-[20%] translate-y-[20%]

### Reproduce example - [codesandbox](https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/dark-mode-w2s4gd?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx%3A28%2C50)

### I tried 1. Delete node_modules and package.json.lock and `yarn` 2. Put this setting in my settings.json (I use vscode) ```json "tailwindCSS.experimentalCSSValidation": false, ``` I got this error ``` Unknown Configuration Setting ``` **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** ``` "dependencies": { "tailwind-merge": "^1.14.0", }, "devDependencies": { "autoprefixer": "^10.4.15", "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3", "postcss": "^8.4.28", ``` **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** React + Vite + TypeScript + tailwind + zustand
package.json ```json { "name": "codesandbox-dark-mode", "private": true, "version": "0.0.0", "type": "module", "scripts": { "dev": "vite --port 8000", "build": "tsc && vite build", "lint": "eslint src --ext ts,tsx --report-unused-disable-directives --max-warnings 0", "preview": "vite preview" }, "dependencies": { "@types/node": "^20.5.0", "class-variance-authority": "^0.7.0", "react": "^18.2.0", "react-dom": "^18.2.0", "react-icons": "^4.10.1", "react-router": "^6.12.1", "react-router-dom": "^6.12.1", "tailwind-merge": "^1.14.0", "zustand": "^4.4.1" }, "devDependencies": { "@types/react": "^18.2.7", "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.4", "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^5.57.1", "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^5.57.1", "@vitejs/plugin-react-swc": "^3.0.0", "autoprefixer": "^10.4.15", "eslint": "^8.38.0", "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^4.6.0", "eslint-plugin-react-refresh": "^0.3.4", "postcss": "^8.4.28", "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3", "typescript": "^5.0.2", "vite": "^4.3.2" } } ```
**What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.17.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Kali linux (Is it take matter?)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict)" (#11839)
